skillTree.localised_description: A general's horse can be their most trusted and daring companion. Just don't name him 'Daisy'.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

skillTree.localised_description: An Imperial pegasus is a noble, winged steed, intelligent and loyal.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: Once trained to carry a man in battle, Imperial griffons are poised killers and incredibly dedicated to their riders.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord belts out orders and can be heard even across a battlefield smothered in the grim noise of war.
Those who bear the Mark of Hysh are practitioners of the magical Lore of Light, and the bane of Chaos, for they are able to control and manipulate the White Wind of Magic.
The relentless drive and fury of the Hammer, harnessed for the protection of this ward’s bearer.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: This one's deeds are legendary, inspiring mercenaries and heroes alike to join their cause.

effects.description: Unit capacity: +1 for Regiments of Renown
Unit capacity: +2 for Regiments of Renown
Unit capacity: +3 for Regiments of Renown

skillTree.localised_description: A veteran of countless battles, this one has a hunger for slaughter and a thirst for blood.
One doesn't reach the rank of General without having survived many a battle.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +20% for this Lord

skillTree.localised_description: This one's many courageous deeds are celebrated far and wide across the Empire, with many speaking of their might and determination in the very thick of battle.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: The blades of the Empire slice through the enemy like so many knives through so much fleshy butter.
Courage, duty, honour – all meaningless without discipline. This commander demands their troops be perfectly drilled, that they may stand fast against even the darkest of the Empire's foes.
With their general at its head, the Empire's cavalry charge into battle with great zeal.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +10 for Cavalry units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Having friends in the high places of Imperial society has its benefits. It's always *who* you know...
This one is loved and respected by their troops, many of whom have come from all over the world to fight at their side.
Sometimes the best offense is, in fact, simply the embodiment of offense; a champion who can scythe through weaklings like wheat and shatter even the strongest defense.
This one is no mere brute, but a warrior capable of leading or delaying blows to catch foes off guard, bypassing defenses and dodges alike.

Skill holds value, but strength seizes results. All the skill in the world, the prettiest lies and the hardest invective, serve only to obscure the truth of the world - that one must have the might to destroy , and the will to use it, to change anything.

The force of arrival is a profound weapon, one all too many warriors neglect. Not merely in presentation, though that is also important - but the bone-shattering force of the first onslaught, before the foe has your measure; before they know they should be running.

On the field of battle, few fights indeed boil down to something as nice and pretty as an honorable duel. Victory comes, not as the result of fair combat - but the ability to tear through battle lines, alone or with an army, until there are none left to oppose you.
Defense comes in many forms; blocking, parrying, avoiding, or simply ignoring an attack entirely all serve to avoid harm and demoralize a foe who cannot truly harm you.
Trickery and agility are useful enough, but little displays innate strength as well as being able to simply shrug off cannonballs and shrieking daemonflame alike.

The essence of victory in a duel is simple; do not be where your opponent's blade is. Easier said than done, for some. But this one knows the truth. They know how to move, or how to predict, though it is never quite clear to the foe what that truth may be.
The flesh is weak. It can bleed and burn. Iron, literal or metaphorical, is the truest defense. Whether through plate armor or potent wards, this warrior is no easy mark.
True invincibility may be a vanishing dream, but one can come close enough that the difference is academic at best on the battlefield.
A general's mind is as important a weapon as any blade, and must be honed just the same. To master the self is to master the world, using their army as an extension of themselves.
Too many warriors believe that movement is not a part of battle - but there is no battle without movement. Those that think statically are forever doomed to be run circles around by their foe.

Few can claim to truly be tireless, and those that are oft trade that boon for the will of a demanding god. But even the least man or grot can be trained to move beyond their limits, to keep going where their equals fade and fall.

effects.description:
Vigour loss reduction: -5% for units
	(Lord's army)

Vigour loss reduction: -10% for units
	(Lord's army)

Vigour loss reduction: -15% for units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who march beneath this general's banner take pride in their presence. They are more than an army - they are an ideal, and ideals never die.

There are those whose very presence awakens something new in the hearts of their followers; whether through fear, admiration, or devotion, a single thought crosses the minds of all those that behold them. 'I would die for them' 'I would kill for them.' It is difficult to tell which is the most terrifying.
Pure strength and arcane mastery are valid paths to victory, but cultivating the skill to step up when needed can break stalemates and lead to victory.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
This one excels in the heat of the moment, pitting the peak of their skill against their foe's and learning which is the greater.
Even an unstoppable force cannot break an immovable object. Learning to stem the tide, to stand against all comers and survive, can turn defeat into victory.

The Empire has stood against countless threats over the years, threats within and without. Greenskins, Vampires, Chaos; men and monsters alike. By faith, steel, and gunpowder, they will be driven forth.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +2 for Melee Infantry units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +4% for Cavalry units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Aggressive deployment of experienced shock infantry can create gaps in the frontlines of opposing forces, openings to exploit with auxiliary forces or elite infantry.

Melee attack: +2 for all infantry and monstrous infantry

Charge bonus: +10 for all infantry and monstrous infantry (Rank 4 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Vigour loss reduction: -30% for all infantry and monstrous infantry (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Combined-arms tactics fall apart if the line cannot hold. Thus, it is not that the line should hold - it must hold. There is no other option. Old hands and old warriors, united to protect that which lies behind them.

effects.description:
Melee defense: +2 for all infantry and monstrous infantry
	(Lord's army)

Armor: +4 for all infantry and monstrous infantry
	(Lord's army)

Melee defense: +4 for all infantry and monstrous infantry
	(Lord's army)

Spell resistance: +20% for all infantry and monstrous infantry (Rank 4 and above)

Ward save: +10% for all infantry and monstrous infantry (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Squad- and regiment-size fire support takes many forms, but offers reasonable mobility and on-the-spot fire support for engaged allies, usually from medium range.

effects.description:
Missile damage: +5% for all missile infantry, monstrous infantry, and cavalry
	(Lord's army)

Range: +5% for all missile infantry, monstrous infantry, and cavalry
	(Lord's army)

Missile damage: +10% for all missile infantry, monstrous infantry, and cavalry
	(Lord's army)

Range: +10% for all missile infantry, monstrous infantry, and cavalry

Missile damage: +15% for all missile infantry, monstrous infantry, and cavalry

	(Lord's army)

Enable Ability: "Peerless Aim" for all missile infantry, monstrous infantry, and cavalry (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Heavy fire support can take many forms, but tend to bring firepower to bear that is difficult or impossible to match by smaller units. Whether through unmatched mobile fire support or raw potency of earth-rending barrages, it can demoralize and tear opposing forces apart.

effects.description:
Ammunition: +5% for all artillery, monstrous artillery, and warmachines
	(Lord's army)

Reload speed: +5% for all artillery, monstrous artillery, and warmachines
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +10% for all artillery, monstrous artillery, and warmachines

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Beasts of war, born of flesh and steel. Often imposing or outright terrifying, they shine as linebreakers and unignorable distractions, forcing the foe to dedicate significant resources to put them down rather than on more vulnerable auxiliaries.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +5% for all monsters and warmachines
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: +5% for all monsters and warmachines
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +10% for all monsters and warmachines
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: +10% for all monsters and warmachines
	(Lord's army)

Splash attack power: +20% for all monsters and warmachines (Rank 4 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Splash attack power: +20% for all monsters and warmachines (Rank 4 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Attribute: Strider for all monsters and warmachines (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.
Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

skillTree.localised_description: Fast support units tend to lack the staying power of line forces, but offer unmatched mobility and potent shock potential to a balanced army. Preying on vulnerable support forces or engaged infantry, a thunderous charge or howling assault can shatter enemy forces in seconds.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +5 for all cavalry, hounds and chariots
	(Lord's army)

Movement speed: +5% for all cavalry, hounds and chariots
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +10 for all cavalry, hounds and chariots
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Ability: Old Hunters for all cavalry, hounds and warmachines (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Where battlefield conditions and the flow of battle permits, taking the opportunity to press forwards can push battle lines forwards.
Ride for ruin, and the world's ending.

stat_effects.description: x0.001 Dealt Collision Knocked Back Threshold
x0.001 Dealt Collision Knocked Down Threshold
x0.001 Dealt Collision Knocked Flying Threshold

skillTree.localised_description: Volley after volley will cut down foes, leaving nothing but a sea of corpses.

Pure power must be matched by disciplined determination - the ability to follow formation and not overextend in a wild frenzy of destruction. Pacing themselves allows a warrior to fight on, dealing accurate blows for longer.
Power is the only absolute. Let them cower behind their armor, their battle-hyms, their war-cries. They will break before our weapons will.
Even with all the cards seemingly against them, a sturdy defense led by the bravest or boldest can hold the line until conditions improve.

Advancing into hellfire amidst a storm of steel requires warriors built of sterner stuff. Learning how to approach volleys of gunfire or screaming warpflame, how to utilize armor or blades to deflect or dampen it. Surviving the training makes the battlefield itself seem trivial.

Even the greatest generals must sometimes concede the initiative to the foe -but to do so is not to concede the battle. If one can weather the storm, if they can survive the hardest strikes, the opportunity to strike back will always, always present itself.

attributes.bullet_text: When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.

skillTree.localised_description: Mobility is perhaps the greatest weapon a warrior can wield. Outmaneuvering the foe, pressing the advantage, can turn even a sure defeat into victory.
Wars are won, not merely by strength of arms, but by supply lines and grand strategy. Winning a single battle means nothing if that victory is not in pursuit of a greater purpose.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: An army is only as fast as its slowest contingent. Understanding and applying this concept allows for unorthodox tactics and outmaneuvering the foe.

This general has a knack for attracting others to their cause and gauging exactly how far they can drive their forces, minimizing unnecessary losses and making it easier to replace fallen forces with willing warriors.
It is said that supplies win war rather than strategy. Perspective may temper one's opinion on that claim, but having resilient supply lines that can keep troops in good form does help.

Penetrating hostile territory where the land is as dangerous as its inhabitants can cause tremendous damage to an army and strain supply lines, unless properly reinforced and supported by effective scouting allowing for relatively safe passage.

effects.description:
Attrition: -25% casualties suffered from attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -50% casualties suffered from attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Whether this general possesses true prescience or merely some facsimile of it is a subject of some debate, but the efficacy of their judgements is difficult to question. Few succeed at surprising them, and fewer still can do so on the field of battle.
Ths lord is not merely a general by necessity, or even choice; it is simply a natural evolution of what they are - of who they are.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +50
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: New recruits must be broken in order to be remade, undergoing harsh training now in order to become part of the elite.
Finding high quality recruits for any army can be difficult, but made much easier by a network of competent recruiters that can find more and more to join the cause.
Recruiting the finest forces to be found and training them harder than anyone else leads to unusually high quality additions to the army.

effects.description:
Unit recruit rank: +1
	(armies in local province)

Unit recruit rank: +2
	(armies in local province)

Unit recruit rank: +3
	(armies in local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Training does not end when war begins; an army that is not marching or fighting is ripe for rigorous practice, and any flaws in their previous training can always be identified and corrected as possible.
Expertise in a particular territory leaves this general better prepared to govern than most, in whatever manner best sorts their kind.

effects.description:
Construction cost: -10% for all buildings
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: This lord's name is spread wherever they go, inspiring fear and adulation alike. Whether bolstered by overwhelming charisma, arcane might, or unfathomable cruelty, the populace is acutely aware of their presence - and their might.
The pure and the good need not share a bed, but against the fires of truth there can be no shelter for those that would twist and turn against the natural order.
An empire cannot thrive without its people, and an army cannot march without warm bodies to fill it. How this lord encourage such proliferation is perhaps best left to the imagination.
Honeyed words may not be the fastest way to take over a country compared to strength of arms, but this one's silver tongue can accomplish seemingly anything.
A mind is a terrible thing to waste. This lord does not allow military responsibilities to quell their value in technological contributions.
Few excel at ravaging the lands of their foes as much as this one. Leaving a bloody trail in their wake, they turn the lands and peoples of their foes into fuel for their war.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +20%

skillTree.localised_description: Striking like the storm, this general has drilled their army to deploy far faster than most. Able to force the foe into disadvantageous fights before marshalling their own forces, this army is rarely engaged on even terms.

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: If they cannot control these realms, this lord will burn it down around them.
The only true form of control over a thing is the power to destroy it.

effects.description:
Rewards: +10% from looting, razing, sacking, and post-battle income
	(Lord's army)

Rewards: +20% from looting, razing, sacking, and post-battle income
	(Lord's army)

Rewards: +30% from looting, razing, sacking, and post-battle income
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Few have a talent for catching enemy armies off-guard like this one, always striking when the foe is marching or recuperating.
This one is wreathed in a sense of gravitas that draws the best and brightest to them like moths to the flame, eager to learn - or perhaps take it for themselves.

Leading entire armies of men, daemons, or monsters is not a task for the average warrior. Understanding the strategies needed to get the a concentration of force to the appropriate location, and the tactics needed to make use of it against another force, requires a mixture of practice and experience.
Heroes are future lords and legends - valiant fighters or potent sorcerers, each well worth the investment for the future.

Generals require excellent lieutenants to command their forces effectively - a concept this lord has taken to heart, taking great pain to cultivate the best and brightest amongst their entourages to ever greater heights.

No army can master every aspect of combat without compromising in some aspects. Making use of auxilaries from allied forces allows for a more versatile approach to combat, especially if the disparate units train together.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: A regal air? Let's see how long that lasts.

effects.description:
Chance to gain a magic item: 5% per turn
	(factionwide)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "The smallfolk should be thankful - without us, who would they work for?"

effects.description:
Upkeep: -25%
	(characters's army when in own territory)

Construction time: -25% for all buildings
	(local region)

Melee attack: +4 for all units (Rank 7 and above)
	(own army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Franz has put his trust in this man; pray he does not let him down!

related_attributes.bullet_text:
When charging into an enemy unit:
	  Charge Bonus duration is doubled.
	 Enemy units take a  Leadership penalty as if they have been attacked in the flank.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The thrill of the chase, the tremor as the quarry is cornered, the ecstasy of the kill. These are the things that matter.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).
When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any large attacker.
When bracing, this unit causes additional damage when attacking charging enemies.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.
This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description: Greatly reduced chance of being detected while in ambush stance

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).
When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any large attacker.
When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +10% for units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
Well built, robust. Powerful.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +5%
	(all units in army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +500 metres without incurring any time penalty

Missile strength: +10% for units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Reikland is home to many of the Knightly Orders of the Empire, and this general is a former member of the Inner Circle of the Reiksgard. The power of an elite cavalry force cannot be denied.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +10 for all cavalry, hounds and chariots
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Often dispateched all over the Empire to defend their neighbors, soldiers of Reikland are some fo the most skilled in the Empire, with experience in both offense and defense.
Reikland steel is the surest promise of safety the province can offer its sons, reused and recycled into new armor as necessary to ensure the frontline is as tough as possible.
Wissenland is legendary for its black-powder weaponry, none greater than the artillery churned out by the forges of Nuln.

effects.description:
Reload time reduction: +10% for Artillery units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Wissenland gunners are well trained in volley fire and handling various missile weapons, especially when overseen by a former forgemaster.

effects.description:
Range: +10% for Missile Infantry units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +10% for Missile Infantry units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Training, supply lines, cleaning up incidents, knowing how to bring firepower to bear optimally; a true combined-arms approach utilizing missile weapons with adequate redundancy takes a special kind of man.

Hochland has long supplied some of the most skilled archers and gunners in all the Empire. Trained from birth and only ever pressed harder by the rigors of military life, any Hochland battallion are guaranteed to be crack shots.

effects.description:
Range: +15% for Missile Infantry units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: While skilled with any form of missile weapons, Hochland natives have always preferred the bow and arrow over other missile weapons, crossbows and black-powder alike. The eyes of a hawk and the aim of an elf, tempted by the grit of the Empire.

effects.description:
Armor-piercing missile damage: +150% for Archers and Huntsmen
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +20% for Missile Infantry units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The Udoses tribe that most Ostlanders descend from were known as some of the toughest tribesmen to walk the past, and modern Ostlanders are no different. Stubborn, tough, and determined, they never back down.

The Jutons that eventually became the men of Nordland weredisciplined, for savages - but savages nonetheless. Even today, their descendants bear great strength and a harsh, decisive approach to melee combat.

effects.description:
Base weapon damage: +8 for units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +3 for Melee Infantry units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The Juton of old were known for their discipline, but the modern men of Nordland are perhaps even more brutal than their forebearers. Ever eager to enter the fight, and deadly loath to leave it, a true Nordlander can be counted on to hurl themselves into the fray.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: While neighboring Hochland and Nordland are known for their woodsmen as well, few embody that natural knowledge like Talabeclanders. A quiet pride carries a truly impressive degree of knowledge, and a oneness with the forest  almost akin to an elf.

effects.description:
Ward save: 10% during forest battles
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can pass through trees.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Practicality meets the lore of the wilds as key to the mindset of any true son of Talabecland. Weaving their way through the densest forests or most forbidding terrain, somehow keeping their supply train intact, takes a breadth of logistical experience and simple efficiency none can deny.

Some say that the men of Middenland never really evolved beyond the primitive Teutogen tribe they call ancestor. Those individuals would be best served not saying such things in earshot of any Middenlander. Despite their stubbornness and seeming savagery, these brave warriors bring great strength and honor to bear on the battlefield.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +3 for Melee Infantry units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +15% for Melee Infantry units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The Tutokin people were ruthless, brutal warriors, and that spirit still holds strong in moddern Middenland. First into the fray, born by the savage fury of the great wolf himself, the sons of Ulric will never falter on the attack.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +10 for melee infantry
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Averland is known for its great plains and animal husbandry. Fitting, then, that it should sire some of the best horses and riders alike in all the Empire. Less well-known than the finest of Reikland, perhaps, but no less proud and no less skilled.

effects.description:
Vigour loss reduction: -15% for Cavalry units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Known for its horses and riders alike, it is no surprise that the sons of Averland would excel at all forms of mounted combat, combining both martial mastery and ranged firepower to devastating effect.

effects.description:
Missile damage: +15% for cavalry and War Wagons
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: While the Eonir of Laurelorn Forest rarely share their gifts with the Nordlanders encroaching on their forest, they are far more open than most Asrai. A former diplomat who has spent a fair amount of time with elven warriors, this general trains his troops similarly, attempting to emulate true Elven mastery with limited success.
This general funds and trains their soldiers better than most, lending surprising resilience to their frontline.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +3 for Melee Infantry units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +3 for Melee Infantry units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Warfare is a messy, noisy affair. Gunners must be drilled relentlessly to act more efficiently in battle, until it is as natural to them as breathing.

effects.description:
Ammunition: +15% for Missile Infantry units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +10% for Missile Infantry units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Born in Hochland, this general is utterly relentless in prioritizing the aim of their troops. Better to strike true on the first shot than to need a second.

effects.description:
Range: +15% for Missile Infantry units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: -10% for Missile Infantry units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The rumbling roar of cannon-fire, the wistling of rockets overhead, the stench of gunpowder; is there any greater joy?

effects.description:
Missile strength: +15% for Artillery units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: A specialist in cavalry tactics, this general relies more heavily than most on heavy cavalry to punch holes in enemy lines.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +10 for all cavalry, hounds and chariots
	(Lord's army)

Movement speed: +15% for all cavalry, hounds and chariots
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Hammer and anvil tactics may be among the most simple and well-known of them all - but faith, steel, and men hard enough to hold the line lend it weight nonetheless.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +10 for all cavalry, hounds and chariots
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +3 for Melee Infantry units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The importance of mobile fire support cannot be overestimated; nearly immune to counter-battery fire and flanking alike, these quick horsemen can tear apart an enemy formation by themselves.

effects.description:
Armor-piercing missile damage: +5 for Pistoliers
	(Lord's army)

Reload speed: +15% for War Wagons
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The horrors assaulting mankind simply require stronger men to cut them down. This general devotes their training and supply lines alike to that purpose, cutting corners elsewhere.
